newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late palm olein down in dull trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late palm olein down in dull trade.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices inched lower in late trading on Monday as buyers stayed sidelined amid increasing selling pressure, traders said.
They said olein was generally at 1,365-70 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, down from 1,370-75 rupiah at the opening. They said offers were also heard at 1,355-60 rupiah/kg.
"There was very little buying interest," one trader said. "Buyers are not keen because they feel prices will decline further...how much further is everybody's question."
Traders said one player was unloading a shipment of 4,800 tonnes of olein in Jakarta.
They said another shipment of 5,500 tonnes of olein, apparently imported by state logistics agency from Malaysia, was expected to enter the Jakarta market next week.
Traders said olein prices have fallen by about 100 rupiah/kg in recent weeks because the market was oversold.
"The market was oversold and prices had to come down," one trader said. "Prices will dip a bit more before they recover. Prices should be doing better by next month."
